biz.source_code.dsp.signal

Class EnvelopeDetector

  • java.lang.Object
    • biz.source_code.dsp.signal.EnvelopeDetector

  • public class EnvelopeDetector
extends Object
    An envelope detector.

    The input signal is filtered by a bandpass filter before the envelope is detected.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EnvelopeDetector(int samplingRate)
      Constructs an envelope detector with default parameters for audio / speech.
      EnvelopeDetector(int samplingRate, double attackTime, double releaseTime, IirFilter iirFilter)
      Constructs an envelope detector.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float[] process(float[] in)
      Processes an array of input signal values and returns an array containing the envelope levels.
      double step(double inputValue)
      Processes one input signal value and returns the current envelope level.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • EnvelopeDetector

        public EnvelopeDetector(int samplingRate)
        Constructs an envelope detector with default parameters for audio / speech.
        Parameters:
        samplingRate - Sampling rate in Hz.

      • EnvelopeDetector

        public EnvelopeDetector(int samplingRate,
                        double attackTime,
                        double releaseTime,
                        IirFilter iirFilter)
        Constructs an envelope detector.
        Parameters:
        samplingRate - Sampling rate in Hz.
        attackTime - Attack time of the envelope detector in seconds (time for 1/e convergence).
        releaseTime - Release time of the envelope detector in seconds (time for 1/e convergence).
        iirFilter - Filter for pre-processing the signal. May be null to bypass filtering.

    • Method Detail

      • step

        public double step(double inputValue)
        Processes one input signal value and returns the current envelope level.

      • process

        public float[] process(float[] in)
        Processes an array of input signal values and returns an array containing the envelope levels.
